@raise_exception @zapper_fi Next up, we will get rid of the brute-force approach on the backend to know what apps the user has interacted with by compiling a view of holdings for every user via ETLs built from blockchain events.

@raise_exception @zapper_fi The client used to fetch these supported apps with a first roundtrip and then balances via multiple HTTP/2 requests. But with streaming we perform a single call. This eliminates the necessity for this initial network roundtrip.

@raise_exception @zapper_fi Indeed, on a first load Zapper will brute-force balances for all applications, but then it caches the set of apps used by the user in the backend. This cache needs to be in the backend so it can be invalidated if the user performs a transaction on-chain.
@maonini_ @InnerFire11 @Deadfellaznft ğŸ‘€
@alexsnaps @jonhoo Ohhh need to get that one.
@voogarix @zapper_fi We're on it

@cory_eth @zapper_fi We are not using websockets but "server-sent events" over http which is a form of streaming. Every X seconds the client requests balances with a single request and the server streams them as they get computed. Once all the balances are returned the connection is closed.
@chrishobcroft @latetot @zapper_fi We shipped the change yesterday but optimized even more today.
@KryptoSimoon @zapper_fi https://t.co/PzFRp3mCNP
@0x_hiatus @zapper_fi It's in our pipeline!

@0x_Osprey @zapper_fi It's hard to give a precise number without accurate client side instrumentation. Comparing backend metrics would be comparing apples and oranges. But cache hits are almost instant now and cache misses are at least 2x faster.. I guess? ğŸ˜„

@0x_Osprey @zapper_fi We eliminated a network roundtrip that was required before fetching balances. So that's a ~200ms shaved off. We also got rid of request queueing in the browser and there's overall less client overhead.

Have you noticed @zapper_fi got faster?

We changed the way we fetch balances and now use streaming instead of parallelizing HTTP/2 requests. 

That's just the beginning though ğŸ˜. We have other huge improvements coming soon.
